thread.title: QBE: England v Ireland tickets: Terms and conditions
thread.title_full: QBE: England v Ireland tickets: Terms and conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: QBE: England v Ireland tickets: Terms and conditions
text: QBE - England v Ireland Tickets Prize Draw – Terms and Conditions 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), QBE Management Services (UK) Limited (“QBE”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via www.telegraph.co.uk/qberugbycomp and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winner’s name and county can be obtained by sending a sae to QBE – England v Ireland Tickets Prize Draw Winner, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Monday 24 August 2015. 6. The winner will be contacted by the Promoter by telephone or email by 5pm on Tuesday 1 September 2015. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner by this deadline or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 8. One winning entrant will win two tickets to see England v Ireland at Twickenham on Saturday 5 September 2015. 9. The prize does not include travel to or from the event, accommodation, food and drink, personal expenditure or incidental costs. The prizes are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 10. The prize is subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 11. The winner may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of QBE and the Promoter. 12. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 13. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter. Accordingly the Promoter may, at its absolute discretion, vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 14. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prize is the responsibility of QBE. 15. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT. Online Form - QBE: England v Ireland tickets: Terms and conditions @telegraph
